summary: The CIA enlists two journalists in a plot to assassinate North Korean leader Kim Jong Un.
A modern, muscial take on Brothers Grimm fairy tales that blends together the stories of Cinderella, Jack and the Beanstalk, Rapunzel and Little Red Riding Hood.
Loosely based on a true story about Navy SEAL marksman Chris Kyle and his experiences in the Iraq War. Directed by Clint Eastwood and starring Bradley Cooper.
The story of World War II hero Louis Zamperini. Directed by Angelina Jolie.
Liam Neeson plays CIA operative Bryan Mills for a third time. This time, instead of a kidnapping, the plot centers around Neeson being framed for the murder of his ex-wife.
Benedict Cumberbatch plays British mathematician and cryptologist Alan Turing who deciphered the Enigma code, hel[ping to halt the Nazis during World War II.
The drama, set at the height of the civil rights movement, shows Martin Luther King Jr. and others fighting for suffrage and equality.
A darker, deeper turn by Jennifer Aniston, who plays a woman dealing with chronic pain.
The year is 1981, and crime is at an all-time high in New York City, where ambition drives a struggle to achieve the American Dream.
Filmed over 12 years, the coming-of-age movie follows the actors as they age.
Wes Anderson's eighth film is centered on an opulent, pastel-pink, palatial hotel in a spa town in the fictional Eastern European republic of Zubrowka in the early 1930s.
When Kevin Hart wants to marry his girlfriend, there's just one obstacle: her cop brother played by Ice Cube
Chris Pine and Keira Knightley star in this sexy tale of travel and espionage.
The bro-mantic comedy, starring Zac Efron, follows three New York guys on a quest for love in 2014.
A warmhearted, goofy celebration of creativity, The Lego Movie builds on a sweet tale of finding one's inner imaginative child.
Kevin Hart anchors this relationship comedy about love and one-night stands.
When disaster hits the infamous city of Pompeii, the movie goes up in smoke.
Everyone aboard the plane is a suspect in the attempted extortion and murder plot in this enjoyably implausible thriller
Will Ferrell's Ron Burgundy is back. The comedy shows a distraught Burgundy moving into the 24-hour news cycle.
Street racing is the star of this action flick led by Aaron Paul.
Kristen Bell reprises the sassy sleuth role she played for three TV seasons — and maturity has made her only more charming.
Jason Bateman stars in the comedy full of dirty jokes and raunchy spelling.
Another Young Adult series comes to life in this dystopian thriller.
The biblical epic, starring Russell Crowe, recounts the story of Noah and the flood.
A tale of love turns to revenge when three women discover they're sharing the same man.
Spidey is back and better than ever as he fends off Electro, Rhino and the Green Goblin.
Seth Rogen moves his family into a new home with new neighbors: a house full of fraternity brothers.
When cooking's your passion but you've had enough of restaurant life, what's next? Quitting your job and starting a food-truck business.
This drama shows the trials and tribulations of moving away from your home and starting life anew in a different country.
The comic superheroes hop off the screen, as Wolverine, Mystique and Professor X work against a force that's trying to kill them.
Angelina Jolie shines in the titular role of one of Disney's most iconic villians.
Grab a box of tissues. This teen tragedy tells the story of true love even in the face of a deadly disease.
Emily Blunt and Tom Cruise star in this futuristic thriller.
In a breakout role for Saturday Night Live alum Jenny Slate, life is turned upside down when a series of break-ups and mistakes take their toll.
The boys are back and they're going to college. Jonah Hill and Channing Tatum star in the sequel to their wildly popular 2012 comedy.
When the world freezes over, survivors take to trains and start new lives in this wintry chiller.
It's never too late for a second chance. Mark Ruffalo plays a struggling music exec who discovers his latest talent, a musician played by Keira Knightley.

movietitle: Dawn of the Planet of the Apes
summary: The prequel to the famed series about apes seizing control of the planet.
Scarlett Johansson takes no prisoners when searching for answers about her newfound mental prowess.
It's a 20something takeover in this dramedy starring Anna Kendrick and Lena Dunham.
Phillip Seymour Hoffman takes the screen in his final role before his death.
Starlord and his bandit of misfit anti-heroes turn their criminal pasts into promise in the latest from Marvel.
James Brown is an icon. In this biopic, we learn more about the legendeary soul singer.
Helen Mirren is an established chef who has no room for criticism until an Indian resturant just across the street changes her thinking.
The dystopian classic shows a world where control is everything ... until you see the color behind it all.
The romantic drama places our lead character outside her body after a horrific accident.

movietitle: This Is Where I Leave You
summary: When their father passes, four siblings come together to remember his life and, naturally, the drama unfolds when they all return under one roof.
Kristen Wiig and Bill Hader play dysfunctional siblings in this dark comedy.
British gay-rights activists lend support to a miners' strike and tensions collide.
The quirky, animated comedy tells the story of a boy raised by, you guessed it, a group of boxtrolls.
Gillian Flynn's best seller takes creepy to a new level in this "whodunit" murder mystery.
Wide-eyed dolls are among the most terrifiying things out there, and this horror flick stars one.
One drummer, Miles Teller, is pushed to his limit by an infamously difficult conductor.
Robert Downey Jr. and Robert Duvall square off in this father-son legal drama.
Bill Murray stars as an older man who befriends the son of a single mother.
This World War II drama brings gore and solid acting in a fresh take on warfare.
The vibrant visuals in this animated picture bring the color and life of Mexico's Dia de los Muertos to new audiences.
A washed-up actor tries to rediscover himself in this moving piece.
A radio host at a small college helps to start a dialogue about race at her predominantly white campus.
Jake Gyllenhaal soars as a certified creep in this dark, provocative thriller.
Christopher Nolan's latest venture takes viewers into outer space in the search for a new source for sustaining life.
Called the next Frozen, this heartwarming kids' movie has a thing or two to teach everyone.
Stephen Hawking remains one of science's most prolific contributors, but you know only a slice of his story.
Steve Carrell steps out of his comedic comfort zone for this creepy wrestling drama.
Fame and fortune are the stars of this pop starlet's rise to stardom.
Jon Stewart makes his directorial debut in this dramatic story of journalist Maziar Bahari.
Jim Carrey and Jeff Daniels dumb it down in this sequel 20 year later.
The third film in the Hunger Games franchise. It opens with Katniss Everdeen in District 13 having just destroyed the games.

In the fourth film of the animated Madagascar franchise, penguins travel from Antarctica to Fort Knox to Venice to somewhere in the desert to Shanghai to New York. Benedict Cumberbatch lends his voice as the suave wolf Agent Classified.
Three male friends plot a kidnapping in this comedic sequel. Kevin Spacey makes a cameo.
Reese Witherspoon stars as Cheryl Strayed, a woman who hiked 1,100 miles of the Pacific Crest Trail. Based on Strayed's 2012 memoirs Wild: From Lost to Found.
Julianne Moore portrays a professor stricken with early-onset Alzheimer's disease.
A detective story set in the '70s centered on a drug-addled private eye played by Joaquin Phoenix. Based on the novel by Thomas Pynchon.
A biblical epic starring Christian Bale as Moses leading enslaved Israelites to freedom.
A semiautobigraphic film written, directed and starring Chris Rock. Rock plays comedian/actor Andre Allen who reflects on his career, via an encounter with a determined reporter.
An updated take on the Broadway musical, starring Quvenzhané Wallis as the adorably plucky Annie.
A remake of a '70s drama about a self-destructive academic starring Mark Wahlberg as Jim Bennett, a college English professor with a penchant for high-stakes blackjack games.
